item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

summary.text:
Military Family Prevention, Response, and Other Training to End Military Family Abuse and Connect Communities Today Act or Military Family PROTECT Act

This bill requires the establishment on military installations multidisciplinary teams on child abuse and other domestic violence.

The Defense Health Agency of the Department of Defense must carry out a pilot program on universal nurse home visits for providing families training on safe childcare practices aimed at reducing child abuse and fatalities.

item.title: A bill to provide for multidisciplinary teams for military installations on child abuse and other domestic violence, to require a pilot program on nurse home visits to reduce child abuse and improve safe childcare among military families, and for other purposes.
Military Family Prevention, Response, and Other Training to End Military Family Abuse and Connect Communities Today Act

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Armed Services.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
